item.title: Christine add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "Imagination is the golden-eyed monster that never sleeps. It must be fed; it cannot be ignored." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Christine add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Christine add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Christine add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "What I mean by an educated taste is someone who has the same tastes that I have." -- Edward Albee

item.title: Christine add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Christine add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Christine add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Christine add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Christine add a quote by Lillian Hellman
item.description: "I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions." -- Lillian Hellman

item.title: Christine add a quote by Louis Adamic
item.description: "My grandfather always said that living is like licking honey off a thorn." -- Louis Adamic

item.title: Christine add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Christine add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Christine add a quote by Francesco Petrarca
item.description: "Rarely do great beauty and great virtue dwell together." -- Francesco Petrarca

item.title: Christine add a quote by August Wilson
item.description: "Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing." -- August Wilson

item.title: Christine add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself." -- Anna Quindlen
